meanings.definition: To move in a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was zigging through the field to avoid the fox.
meanings.sent2: The car was zigging in and out of traffic to reach the destination faster.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was zigging around the playground, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The river was zigging through the valley, creating a beautiful natural pattern.
meanings.sent5: The lightning was zigging across the sky, lighting up the night.

meanings.sent1: The football player was zigging to the left to avoid the defender.
meanings.sent2: The driver was zigging to the right to dodge the pothole.
meanings.sent3: The cat was zigging back and forth, trying to catch the elusive laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The conversation was zigging from one topic to another, keeping everyone on their toes.
meanings.sent5: The plot of the movie was zigging unexpectedly, surprising the audience.
